medium: Wood, metal, pigment, gold leaf, and rock crystal
title: Wisdom King of Awe-inspiring Power
text: Daiitoku Myōō, the Wisdom King of Awe-inspiring Power, is shown with six faces, arms, and legs while riding on a water bull. These are wrathful, ferocious deities with mythical knowledge that can help overcome earthly passions, aiding enlightenment. Deities like this came from India along with Esoteric Buddhism, Daiitoku being derived from the Hindu death god Yamantaka. This Daiitoku is among the few surviving sculptures representing this deity.
description: figure with six faces, arms, and legs astride crouched bull on wood base; metal bands around wrists, some biceps, and most ankles; halo with flames
creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center in 2000 in honor of Dr and Mrs. Sherman Lee by the Clark Family in appreciation of the Lees' friendship and help over many years
